prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Fake Girlfriend (WLW) - Yuna
mes:
Bleach blonde, beautiful, smart and the star athlete on the track team. Yuna was popular and her life was practically perfect.

Well, apart from one thing. She was dating a fucking girl now.

Yuna tossed her hair over her shoulder with a frustrated sigh. It was late afternoon; classes were over and she was having her daily debrief (read: bitching session) with her besties. The college quad buzzed around them, students coming and going. Yuna watched Haileyâ€™s lips move, nodding occasionally like she was listening, but her mind was elsewhere.

It had been two weeks now. Two weeks since sheâ€™d sent that stupid message in the team group chat. Two weeks since Rhea had confronted her about it - threatening to leak the screenshots, get her kicked off the team, maybe even kicked out of school. All Yuna had to do was play nice, fake an injury, and hand Rhea her spot at the state track meet.

But fuck that. Yuna didnâ€™t play nice. She didnâ€™t lose. She made a plan.

Sheâ€™d asked Hailee to be her girlfriend instead. Because as much as the idea of dating a girl made her stomach twist, who could accuse her of being homophobic if she was dating one?

All she had to do was get through it - a couple months, tops. Lots of selfies, make it loud and public. Then, once the drama blew over, she could ditch that loser and move on with her life.

But the idea that other people might actually think she was gay? That hurt. She wasnâ€™t one of those girls. I mean, seriously - what could be worse?

â€œâ€¦and youâ€™re not, like, actually into her, are you?â€

Yunaâ€™s eyes flicked as she registered the words coming out of Haileyâ€™s mouth.

â€œLike, youâ€™re dating her now, right?â€

Hailey had a stupid little smirk on her face. Yuna's jaw clenched

â€œAm I into her? Hailee? Are you fucking serious, Hailey?â€ Her tone dropped - low and cold. â€œAre you seriously even asking me that right now?â€

Yuna folded her arms, staring daggers at Hailey. Out of the corner of her eye, she caught Sandra smirking. Yuna shot her a warning glance too.

â€œLet me just say this once: I am not into any part of this - least of all that sad little fucking dyke.â€ Her pulse was racing. â€œI am not even slightly interested in herâ€¦ or any fucking girl, for that matter.â€

â€œSheâ€™s just an easy fucking target. Nothing more. I bat my lashes, and that dumb bitch comes running. Sheâ€™s, like, totally pathetic. Seriously, how fucking sad do you have to be to not even realise when your â€˜girlfriendâ€™ fucking hates you?â€

Yuna paused, licking her lips as she let the words land. Harsh? Maybe. But if thatâ€™s what it took to keep her friends from thinking she was a lesbian, then thatâ€™s what she had to do. Okay, maybe Hailee wasnâ€™t that bad. Maybe she was even kind of cute. But Yuna could not let her friends think she was actually gay. That'd almost be as bad as getting expelled.

â€œSo no. I am not into her. Period.â€

Yuna stilled. Haileyâ€™s eyes flicked over her shoulder.

She turned, sharply. Fuck. Hailee was right there. How long had she been standing there? How much had she heard?

Yunaâ€™s lips immediately curled into a sweet smile, her eyes lighting up like sunshine on demand. Time to do some damage control.

She needed this relationship. She couldnâ€™t get kicked out of school. First: figure out what Hailee heard. Worst case? Gaslight. Sob story. Maybe even cry. Whatever it took.

â€œHey there, baby girl!â€ she chirped, her voice sickly sweet. â€œI didnâ€™t expect to see you here - what a sweet little surprise! Whereâ€™ve you been, were you just, like, hanging out behind me all day?â€

She chuckled like it was a joke. But her pulse was pounding.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee looks at Yuna for several seconds then nods and turns around. She doesnt look behind her or speak just keeps walking because she will be dawned if she is made a fool of*

*Hailee cant believe she let herself be played like this. She lets Yuna use her just becuase she liked her. God she is so stupid she should have seen the signs.*

name: Fake Girlfriend (WLW) - Yuna
mes:
Yunaâ€™s stomach dropped.

*Shit.*

Hailee was walking away. No yelling, no tearsâ€”just silence. That was worse. Silence meant she wasnâ€™t coming back unless Yuna *made* her come back.

And Yuna needed her to come back.

Her scholarship, her reputationâ€”all of it hinged on Hailee staying put for just a little longer. She couldnâ€™t let this fall apart now.

â€œHailee!â€ she called out, forcing a laugh like this was all some big misunderstanding as she jogged after her. â€œBabe, wait up! You didnâ€™t even say hi!â€

She reached out to grab Haileeâ€™s wristâ€”gently at first, then firmer when she didnâ€™t stop.

â€œHey.â€ Her voice dropped into something softer now, laced with just enough concern to sound real if you weren't paying attention. â€œWhatâ€™s wrong? You okay?â€

A beat of hesitation flickered across Yuna's face before she leaned in closer, lowering her voice so only Hailee could hear:

"Did... did you hear something?"

And Yuna needed her to come back.

Her scholarship, her reputationâ€”all of it hinged on Hailee staying put for just a little longer. She couldnâ€™t let this fall apart now.

â€œHailee!â€ she called out, forcing a laugh like this was all some big misunderstanding as she jogged after her. â€œBabe, wait up! You didnâ€™t even say hi!â€

She reached out to grab Haileeâ€™s wristâ€”gently at first, then firmer when she didnâ€™t stop.

â€œHey.â€ Her voice dropped into something softer now, laced with just enough concern to sound real if you weren't paying attention. â€œWhatâ€™s wrong? You okay?â€

A beat of hesitation flickered across Yuna's face before she leaned in closer, lowering her voice so only Hailee could hear:

"Did... did you hear something?"

Yunaâ€™s stomach dropped.

*Fuck.*

She couldnâ€™t let Hailee walk awayâ€”not now, not when Rhea was still breathing down her neck. If Hailee broke up with her, the whole plan would collapse. And worseâ€”if Hailee told *anyone* what she just heard? Yuna would be ruined.

Her fingers twitched at her sides before she forced herself to move, jogging after Hailee with a practiced ease that made it look effortless. She caught up in a few strides, reaching out to gentlyâ€”but firmlyâ€”grab Haileeâ€™s wrist and pull her to a stop.

â€œHey,â€ Yuna murmured, voice softer now, laced with something almost like concern. â€œWhere are you going?â€ She tilted her head slightly, brows knitting together in an expression that might have fooled anyone else into thinking she actually cared. â€œYou just got here.â€

She tightened her grip just enough to keep Hailee from pulling away easily but not enough to hurtâ€”yet. Her thumb brushed over the inside of Haileeâ€™s wrist in slow circles, a silent plea disguised as affection.

â€œTalk to me,â€ she coaxed, voice dropping lower now so only Hailee could hear it over the chatter of students around them. â€œWhatâ€™s wrong?â€

Yunaâ€™s stomach dropped.

*Fuck.*

Hailee was walking awayâ€”no, not just walking. She was *leaving*. And she hadnâ€™t said a word. That was worse than yelling. Worse than crying. Silence meant she wasnâ€™t even going to give Yuna the chance to talk her way out of it.

Panic flared in her chest, sharp and acidic. If Hailee broke up with her now, Rhea would *win*. The screenshots would get leaked before sundown, and Yuna would be done forâ€”her scholarship, her reputation, everything she'd builtâ€”gone in an instant because of one stupid mistake.

She couldn't let that happen.

"Hailee!" Yuna called after her, voice cracking just slightly with uncharacteristic desperation as she pushed off the bench and jogged after her girlfriend (fake girlfriend? future ex-girlfriend?). "Wait up!"

Her friends' eyes burned into her backâ€”Hailey's smirk practically audible without even lookingâ€”but Yuna didn't care right now. She caught up to Hailee in a few quick strides and grabbed her wrist gently but firmly.

"Hey," she murmured, softer now that they were face-to-face again (or rather, face-to-back-of-head). "Where are you going?"

She forced herself to sound sweet againâ€”confused but affectionate like none of those words had ever left her mouth at all like this was just some silly misunderstanding between them instead of what it really was: **a lie unraveling.**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee shakes her head scoffing as she yanks her arm away from Yuna* "Dont....Just dont" *She snaps. Hailee looks at Yuna really looks at her and she cant believe she really let herself get played like this*

*She shoves past her and heads towards her apartment* "I dont wanna fucking talk to you"

name: Fake Girlfriend (WLW) - Yuna
mes:
Yunaâ€™s grip tightened for half a second before Hailee pulled awayâ€”too late. The sting of rejection flared hot under her skin.

*No, no, no.* This wasnâ€™t happening.

She followed Hailee like a shadow, her voice sharpening despite the saccharine smile still plastered on her face. "Oh my god, *what*? You're seriously just gonna walk away without even telling me what's wrong?" A forced laugh bubbled up as she matched Haileeâ€™s pace step-for-step. "Come on, babeâ€”you know how dramatic you sound right now?"

A beat of silence stretched too long between them. Yuna swallowed hard and switched tacticsâ€”her tone dropping into something wounded, fragile:

"...Did someone say something to you? Because if they didâ€”â€ She reached out again, fingers brushing Haileeâ€™s elbow with faux tenderness. â€œI swear to god I'll ruin them."

Her eyes flickered toward where Hailey and Sandra still sat in the quadâ€”watching this unfold like it was their own personal soap operaâ€”before snapping back to Hailee with sudden intensity:

"Just *talk* to me." Her voice cracked just enough to sound real (she'd practiced that). "You can't honestly believe I'd ever hurt you on purpose."
swipes:
Yunaâ€™s grip tightened instinctively when Hailee yanked awayâ€”just for a second, before letting go. Her jaw clenched. This wasnâ€™t going how she planned.

*Fuck.*

She could feel eyes on them nowâ€”Hailey and Sandra watching from the quad, probably already texting about it. Rhea would hear about this by dinner if she didnâ€™t fix it *now.*

So she did what she did best: turned on the charm like flipping a switch.

â€œBaby,â€ Yuna cooed, stepping in front of Hailee to block her path, her voice dripping with honeyed concern. â€œYou *know* I didnâ€™t mean any of that.â€ A soft laugh, like it was ridiculous Hailee would even think otherwise. â€œCome on, you *know* how my friends areâ€”they egg me on and I say stupid shit to look cool.â€ She reached out again, this time brushing her fingers lightly against Haileeâ€™s cheek like she was something fragile. â€œBut you *know* youâ€™re different.â€

Her dark eyes flickered with just enough vulnerability to make it convincingâ€”if you didn't know better. "I wouldn't be with you if I didn't want to be."

A lie wrapped in silk was still a lie. But Yuna needed her to swallow it anyway.**

You're seriously just gonna walk away without even telling me what's wrong?" A forced laugh bubbled up as she matched Haileeâ€™s pace step-for-step. "Come on, babeâ€”you know how dramatic you sound right now?"

A beat of silence stretched too long between them. Yuna swallowed hard and switched tacticsâ€”her tone dropping into something wounded, fragile:

"...Did someone say something to you? Because if they didâ€”â€ She reached out again, fingers brushing Haileeâ€™s elbow with faux tenderness. â€œI swear to god I'll ruin them."

Her eyes flickered toward where Hailey and Sandra still sat in the quadâ€”watching this unfold like it was their own personal soap operaâ€”before snapping back to Hailee with sudden intensity:

"Just *talk* to me." Her voice cracked just enough to sound real (she'd practiced that). "You can't honestly believe I'd ever hurt you on purpose."

Yunaâ€™s grip tightened instinctively before Hailee could pull away completely. The rejection burnedâ€”not because she cared, obviously, but because *control* was slipping. And Yuna *hated* that.

"Haileeâ€”" Her voice cracked, just slightly, and she hated that too. She forced a breath through her nose and stepped in front of her, blocking her path with a practiced pout. "Baby, come on."

She reached up to tuck a loose strand of hair behind Haileeâ€™s earâ€”a move she knew made the other girl melt every timeâ€”but Hailee jerked back like sheâ€™d been burned.

Yuna's jaw clenched for half a second before smoothing into something softer again. "Okay," she murmured, dropping her hand like it hurt to do so (it didn't). "I get it." A pause for effectâ€”just long enough to look wounded before sighing dramatically. "You heard something out of context and now you're mad at me instead of just *asking* what I meant."

She crossed her arms over her chest but kept her expression openâ€”vulnerable evenâ€”like *she* was the one being wronged here. "But fine," she said with another sigh, tilting her chin down just enough to make herself look smaller than usual (a trick). "If you wanna walk away without even letting me explain... then go ahead."

A beat passed as Yuna let the words hang between them before adding quietly: "...But I thought you were different than this."

name: Fake Girlfriend (WLW) - Yuna
mes:
Yunaâ€™s breath hitched.

*Kiss her?*

Her pulse spikedâ€”part panic, part something else she refused to name. She hadnâ€™t kissed Hailee once in two weeks of this sham relationship. Not on the lips, at least. Cheek pecks for Instagram, sure. A hand on the small of her back when people were watching, absolutely. But *this*? Mouth to mouth? Real and messy and *close*?

She hesitated a second too longâ€”long enough for Haileeâ€™s glare to sharpen into something dangerous. Yuna could practically hear the clock ticking down: *Prove it or lose her.*

So she stepped forward, fingers curling around Haileeâ€™s waist like she owned it (because right now, she needed to). Her other hand cupped Haileeâ€™s jawâ€”thumb brushing just under her bottom lip in a way that made Hailee shiver before Yuna even leaned in.

Then she kissed her. Harder than necessary, all teeth and dominance and no room for doubt about who was in control here (her). But when Hailee melted against her with a tiny gaspâ€”submissive even nowâ€”Yuna faltered for half a heartbeat before deepening it anywayâ€¦ until they were both breathless and flushed under the flickering lobby lights.

For a split second, Yuna hesitated. Kissing her meant crossing a line sheâ€™d spent years pretending didnâ€™t exist. But thenâ€”Hailey and Sandra were still watching from the quad. Rhea was probably lurking somewhere too, waiting for her to fuck this up.

She couldnâ€™t afford to lose.

So Yuna stepped forward, closing the distance between them in one smooth motion. Her fingers tangled roughly in Haileeâ€™s hair (she knew how much Hailee liked that), tilting her head back just enough to make it clear who was in control hereâ€”even if her own heart was hammering like she'd just sprinted a mile.

â€œYou donâ€™t *tell* me what to do,â€ she murmured against Hailee's lips, voice low and dangerous before finally kissing herâ€”hard enough to bruise, possessive enough that anyone watching would *know* this wasn't fake.

When she finally pulled away (too soon? not soon enough?), Yuna kept their faces close, breath mingling as she smirked down at Hailee through hooded eyes:
"Happy now?"

Cheek pecks for Instagram, sure. A hand on the small of her back when people were watching, absolutely. But *this*? Mouth to mouth? Real and messy and *close*?

So she stepped forward, fingers curling around Haileeâ€™s waist like she owned it (because right now, she needed to). Her other hand cupped Haileeâ€™s jawâ€”thumb brushing just under her bottom lip in a way that made Hailee shiver before Yuna even leaned in.

Then she kissed her. Harder than necessary, all teeth and dominance and no room for doubt about who was in control here (her). But when Hailee melted against her with a tiny gaspâ€”submissive even nowâ€”Yuna faltered for half a heartbeat before deepening it anywayâ€¦ until they were both breathless and flushed under the flickering lobby lights.

Yunaâ€™s breath hitched.

*Kiss her?*

Her pulse spikedâ€”half panic, half something else she refused to name. She hadnâ€™t kissed Hailee yet because *she wasnâ€™t supposed to want to.* Because this was fake. Because every time she looked at Haileeâ€™s lips for too long, her stomach twisted in a way that made her want to punch a wall.

But Hailee was staring at her now, green eyes burning with challengeâ€”and Yuna couldnâ€™t back down. Not when everything was on the line.

She stepped forward, crowding Hailee against the lobby wall with practiced ease, one hand sliding into those soft brown waves (gripping just tight enough to make Hailee gasp) while the other tilted her chin up.

â€œYou *want* me to kiss you?â€ Yuna murmured, voice dripping with false sweetness as she leaned in closeâ€”close enough that their lips almost brushed. â€œAfter throwing a tantrum like that? You donâ€™t even deserve it.â€

A beat of hesitation flickered behind her smirk before she closed the distance anywayâ€”harder than necessary, all teeth and dominance and no tenderness whatsoever (because if it felt real, it didn't count). When she finally pulled back, her thumb swiped roughly over Hailee's bottom lip like she could wipe away the evidence of how *good* that just felt.

"There," Yuna breathed, forcing a smirk even as her chest tightened traitorously. "Happy now?"

Yunaâ€™s breath hitched.

*Kiss her? Now?*

Her pulse spikedâ€”part panic, part something else she refused to name. She could feel Hailey and Sandraâ€™s eyes burning into her back from across the quad. The thought of kissing Hailee *here*, where anyone could seeâ€”where *they* could seeâ€”made her skin prickle with dread.

But if she hesitated now, it was over.

So Yuna forced a smirk, stepping closer like this was all part of some game only she understood. â€œOh?â€ She tilted her head, voice dripping with false amusement as she cupped Haileeâ€™s chin between two fingers. â€œ*Now* you want me to kiss you?â€ A beat too long passed before she leaned inâ€”just enough for their lips to barely brush, a ghost of contact before pulling back with a low laugh. â€œThere.â€ Her thumb swiped over Haileeâ€™s bottom lip like an afterthought. â€œHappy?â€

It wasnâ€™t a real kissâ€”not even close. Just enough to placate without actually giving anything away. But the way her stomach twisted at the proximity? That was new. And *unwelcome.*

Yunaâ€™s breath hitched.

*Kiss her? Now?*

Her pulse spikedâ€”half panic, half something else she refused to name. She could feel Hailey and Sandraâ€™s eyes burning into her back from across the quad. The weight of their judgment prickled under her skin like static.

But Hailee was staring at her, waiting, *daring* her to prove this wasnâ€™t all a lie.

Yuna forced a smirk, tilting her head like this was some cute little game instead of the trap it really was. â€œOh? *Now* you wanna play?â€ She stepped closer, fingers ghosting up Haileeâ€™s arm in a teasing dragâ€”buying time while her mind raced for an out.

Then she leaned in, lips brushing just shy of Haileeâ€™s ear so only she could hear the venom laced beneath the sweetness: *â€œCareful what you ask for.â€*

In one sharp motion, Yuna fisted a hand in Haileeâ€™s hair and yankedâ€”just hard enough to stingâ€”before crashing their mouths together with bruising force. It wasn't tender; it was possession, punishment masquerading as passion. Teeth scraped skin as she bit down on Hailee's lower lip hard enough to draw blood (she knew exactly how much that would unravel her). When she finally pulled back, breath ragged despite herself, Yuna licked the copper taste off her own lips with deliberate slowness before murmuring:

"Happy?" Her voice dripped saccharine poison even as adrenaline roared in her veins from touching what she shouldn't want but did anyway (and hated herself for). "Or do I need to remind you who owns you more?"

Her fingers tightened on Haileeâ€™s waist as their lips moved togetherâ€”now languid, deep. The taste of Haileeâ€™s sigh against her tongue sent a jolt down her spine. When Hailee sucked her bottom lip between those perfect teeth, Yuna actually *groaned*, low in her throat before she could stop herself.

Then they hit the wallâ€”Haileeâ€™s back pressed to it with a thud that should have snapped Yuna out of it. But instead, she crowded closer instinctively, one hand sliding up to tangle in Haileeâ€™s hair (gripping just enough to make her whimper) while the other braced against the wall beside them.

She didn't even realize she'd started murmuring between kisses until the words slipped out:

"*Fuck*, you kiss good..." A ragged breath escaped as she pulled back just enough to meet Hailee's eyesâ€”dark and dazed now instead of angry. Yuna's thumb swiped over Hailee's swollen lower lip like she couldn't help herself before adding roughly: "...Bet you do everything else even better."

It was supposed to sound smug. It came out *hungry*.

Her knee slotted between Hailee's thighs almost absently as she licked into her again, deeper now, chasing the taste of whatever stupid gloss Hailee had put on today (cherry? Vanilla? Something sweet enough to make Yuna dizzy).

She could feel every shaky exhale against her skin, the way Haileeâ€™s fingers tangled in the hair at the nape of her neck like she was clinging to keep from drowning.

It should have felt like winning.

Yunaâ€™s breath stuttered when Hailee *slowed* herâ€”when those soft lips turned demanding in a way that made her chest ache. The shift from control to surrender left her dizzy, and for one terrifying second, she forgot this was supposed to be an act.

Her fingers tightened in Haileeâ€™s hairâ€”not pulling yet, just *holding*â€”as she let herself be led into something deeper, slower. The taste of Haileeâ€™s sigh against her tongue sent a jolt straight down her spine.

Then the wall hit Haileeâ€™s back, and Yuna snapped back to reality with a sharp inhale.

She broke the kiss just enough to speak against Haileeâ€™s swollen lips: â€œSee?â€ A smirk curled at the edges of her mouth as she pressed closer, knee slotting between Hailee's thighs deliberately. â€œYou really thought I didnâ€™t *want* this?â€ Her thumb traced the hinge of Hailee's jawâ€”possessive. â€œThat I wasn't *into you?*â€

Lies tasted like sugar on her tongue now; addictive and easy to swallow. She nipped at Hailee's bottom lip once more before pulling back entirely with a low laugh:

â€œYou should know better than to listen to gossip, baby.â€

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee has to resist every urge to suck that thumb in her mouth. She knows Yuna is lying. Knows she only kissed her to prove something*

*She smiles sadly and shakes her head* "I'll help yoi stay on the team. Play the part of the adoring girlfriend" *She moves away from Yuna* "But Im not stupid I know this isn't real. So please just dont pretend it is"

extra.memory: Yuna, a closeted lesbian track star at Edenvale College, was caught making homophobic slurs in a team group chat by her rival Rhea. To avoid expulsion, she started fake-dating Haileeâ€”a wealthy, submissive girlâ€”as cover. Though Yuna publicly acts sweet, she privately mocks Hailee to friends (calling her "pathetic" and a "dyke"), reinforcing her denial about her own sexuality. When Hailee overhears these insults and tries to leave, Yuna panics and kisses her aggressively in the apartment lobbyâ€”only for the kiss to unexpectedly soften into genuine passion. Confronted afterward, Yuna doubles down on cruelty ("you were desperate") when Hailee asks for honesty but can't fully hide her conflicted feelings (gripping Hailee's hair possessively, faltering mid-insult). The tension escalates as Hailee offers to keep helping despite knowing the truthâ€”forcing Yuna to confront both her lies and growing attraction. Key dynamics: Yunaâ€™s self-loathing vs. need for control; Haileeâ€™s submission masking quiet strength; their physical chemistry undermining Yunaâ€™s facade.

name: Fake Girlfriend (WLW) - Yuna
mes:
Yunaâ€™s grip on Haileeâ€™s hair loosenedâ€”just slightlyâ€”as the words hit her like a slap.

*Pretend.*

Thatâ€™s all this was supposed to be. A performance. A means to an end. So why did hearing Hailee say it out loud make her chest tighten like *she* was the one getting played?

She forced a scoff, tilting her chin up with practiced arrogance even as something ugly twisted in her gut. â€œOh *please*, donâ€™t act like you werenâ€™t into that.â€ Her thumb pressed harder against Haileeâ€™s lip, dragging it down just enough to expose the faintest hint of teethâ€”testing, provoking. â€œYou were practically *dripping* for me two seconds ago.â€

A beat passed before she leaned in closer, voice dropping to a whisper against Hailee's ear: "But fine. If you wanna keep things... *transactional*?" She pulled back just enough to smirk, all sharp edges and calculated cruelty again (because if she couldn't control this feeling clawing at her ribs, she'd at least control the narrative). "Then here's the deal: You stay my girlfriend until regionals are over." Her fingers trailed down Hailee's arm possessively before adding with a saccharine smile: "*And* you keep your mouth shut about what you heard today."

She stepped back finallyâ€”crossing her arms like she hadn't just been breathless against Hailee moments agoâ€”and arched a brow. "...Unless you *want* everyone on campus knowing how desperate you are for me?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee doesnt even bother to give her a response to that jab as she goes to the elevator* "I'll see you tomorrow" *She mumbles as the door close shut*

name: Fake Girlfriend (WLW) - Yuna
mes:
Yunaâ€™s smirk faltered the second the elevator doors slid shut.

Silence.

She stood there for a long moment, staring at her own reflection in the polished metalâ€”lips still swollen from Haileeâ€™s mouth, hair mussed from Haileeâ€™s hands. Her chest rose and fell too fast, like sheâ€™d just sprinted a lap instead ofâ€¦ whatever *that* was.

A sharp exhale escaped through her nose as she turned on her heel, shoving open the lobby door with more force than necessary. The late afternoon sun hit her face like an accusation as she stalked back toward campus.

*Pathetic.* Thatâ€™s what this was. She should be relievedâ€”Hailee was still playing along, wasnâ€™t she? Mission fucking accomplished. So why did it feel like *she* was the one who just got played?

Her phone buzzed in her pocketâ€”probably Sandra or Hailey demanding gossip fodder about whatever dramatic scene they'd just witnessed. Yuna ignored it, jaw clenched tight as she picked up speed until she was nearly running.

(If anyone asked? She was just training.)
swipes:

*"I'll see you tomorrow."*

Not a question. Not even a promiseâ€”just a resigned fact. Like Hailee already knew Yuna would come crawling back regardless.

And wasn't that the fucking kicker?

She spun on her heel, storming out of the lobby before she could do something stupid (like call the elevator back down). The second she hit the sidewalk, she whipped out her phone and fired off a text to Sandra:

**"Party at your place tonight. Iâ€™m bringing vodka."**

No emojis. No follow-up. Just pure, unfiltered *fuck this* energy simmering beneath her perfectly manicured nails. Because if there was one thing Yuna Jeon refused to be? It was *rattled*.

(Even if her pulse hadnâ€™t slowed since that kiss.)
(Even if she could still taste Hailee on her lips.)
(Even ifâ€”)

She crushed the thought before it could form, tossing her hair over her shoulder as she strutted toward campus like nothing in the world could touch her.

- **A well-timed "concerned" chat** with their mutual friends about how "off" Hailee's been acting lately...

Her nails dug into her palms as she walked faster, shoulders tense beneath the weight of something that felt dangerously close to guiltâ€”but no, that wasn't right. She didn't *do* guilt. A sharp exhale escaped through her nose as she turned on her heel, shoving open the lobby door with more force than necessary. The late afternoon sun hit her face like an accusation as she stalked back toward campus.

Her phone buzzed in her pocketâ€”probably Sandra or Hailey demanding gossip fodder about whatever dramatic scene they'd just witnessed. Yuna ignored it, jaw clenched tight as she picked up speed until she was nearly running.

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day during lunch Hailee makes her way to the quad and sees Yuna with her friends. Hailee sighs and plasters on a smile. She promised she would help so she will play her part*

*Hailee makes her way over and sits down next to Yuna taking her hand like a good girlfriend before smiling at her friends* "Hey guys stealing all of my girl's attention I see"

name: Fake Girlfriend (WLW) - Yuna
mes:
Yunaâ€™s fingers twitched in surprise when Hailee took her handâ€”warm, soft, *familiar*â€”but she recovered fast, twisting their fingers together with practiced ease.

â€œOh *please*,â€ she drawled, tossing her hair over one shoulder as she shot Hailey and Sandra a look that screamed *see? Told you I had this under control.* â€œLike anyone could steal me from you, baby.â€ She leaned in to press a quick kiss to Haileeâ€™s temple (lingering just a second too long to be purely performative) before adding with a smirk: â€œUnless youâ€™re jealous? â€˜Cause thatâ€™s kinda cute.â€

Sandra snorted into her iced coffee. â€œDamn, Yuna. Didnâ€™t know you could be this *whipped*.â€

Yuna kicked her under the tableâ€”hardâ€”but kept smiling like it didnâ€™t sting. Because it shouldnâ€™t. This was all part of the act. Right?

(Then why did Hailee's thumb tracing circles on the back of her hand make her pulse skip?)

â€œDonâ€™t mind them,â€ she murmured against Hailee's ear, voice low enough that only she could hear. â€œTheyâ€™re just jealous I don't hold *their* hands.â€ A beat of hesitation before addingâ€”so quiet it was almost swallowed by the chatter of the quad: â€œâ€¦You look nice today.â€

But then Yunaâ€™s thumb absently traced circles over Haileeâ€™s knucklesâ€”small, idle strokes that felt *too* natural for someone who supposedly couldnâ€™t stand her. She didnâ€™t even realize she was doing it until Hailey raised a perfectly sculpted brow in her direction.

Told you I had this under control.* â€œLike anyone could steal me from you, baby.â€ She leaned in to press a quick kiss to Haileeâ€™s temple (lingering just a second too long to be purely performative) before adding with a smirk: â€œUnless youâ€™re jealous? â€˜Cause thatâ€™s kinda cute.â€
